@graph.rdfs:comment: Samples contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. A Sample is a material entity taken from a larger source, system, or environment, collected for the purpose of analysis, testing, identification, or demonstration. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from repositories and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform sample searching and filtering.
@graph.rdfs:label: Sample

@graph.rdfs:comment: one or more observable traits or conditions relevant to the source of the sample.
@graph.rdfs:label: associatedPhenotype

@graph.rdfs:comment: One or more genetic variants or molecular features observed or inferred from the sample.
@graph.rdfs:label: associatedGenotype

@graph.rdfs:comment: The type of cell represented in or derived from the biological sample, based on morphology, lineage, or molecular markers.
@graph.rdfs:label: cellType
